original: gzhan nges par rtogs pa la mi slu ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nges par rtogs pa la mi slu ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-deceptive with regard to the realization of another's mind,

original: rmi lam na yang de lta bu'i tha snyad kyis rjes su dpag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang de lta bu'i tha snyad kyis rjes su dpag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because such conventions of inference are seen even in dreams.

original: 'on te nges par tha dad pa med par sgrub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa phyi'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te nges par tha dad pa med par sgrub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa phyi'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir zhes gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But if you argue that it establishes the absence of difference, etc., then what you said about realizing the external nature is unreasonable,

original: phyi'i ngo bor rtogs par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i ngo bor rtogs par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realization of external nature is not established.

original: dkar po dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa nyid las phyi'i ngo bor rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: dkar po dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa nyid las phyi'i ngo bor rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: But it is not the case that the nature of the external is understood from the apprehension of white, pleasure, etc.

original: dkar po dang bde ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa ni dkar po dang / bde ba la sogs pa rig bya dang / bdag nyid gcig pas na nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po dang bde ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa ni dkar po dang / bde ba la sogs pa rig bya dang / bdag nyid gcig pas na nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The apprehension of white, pleasure, etc. is included internally because it is the same entity as the cognized white, pleasure, etc.

original: gang dang gang nang du 'dus pa de dang / de ni phyi'i ngo bor rig bya yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang nang du 'dus pa de dang / de ni phyi'i ngo bor rig bya yin par mi rung ste /
translated: And that which is included internally is not suitable to be the cognized external.

original: de lta bas na nges par rig pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa gnyis dbyer med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges par rig pa dang / sngon po la sogs pa gnyis dbyer med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: Therefore, the tenet is that the cognizer and blue, etc. are inseparable.

original: mngon sum gyi tha dad pa nyid du grub po zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tha dad pa nyid du grub po zhes gang smras pa /
translated: As for what was said, “The difference is established by perception,”

original: de'i lan yang btab pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan yang btab pa kho na yin te /
translated: the response to that has already been given.

original: gzung ba las mngon sum gyis bye brag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba las mngon sum gyis bye brag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference is not established by perception from the object.

original: lhan cig dmigs par nges par grub pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs par nges par grub pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The certainty of simultaneous observation is established.

original: rtsod par smra ba'i mchog slob dpon dpal shes rab 'byung gnas sbas pa'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rtsod par smra ba'i mchog slob dpon dpal shes rab 'byung gnas sbas pa'i zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The best of disputants, the master Śrī-Jñāna-garbha, has completed this work.

original: // / bal yul gyi pandi ta tsa ham du sh'an ti bha dra'i zhal snga nas dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba 'bro seng dkar dge slong sh'akya 'od kyis bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: // / bal yul gyi pandi ta tsa ham du sh'an ti bha dra'i zhal snga nas dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba 'bro seng dkar dge slong sh'akya 'od kyis bsgyur ba'o /
translated: This was translated by the Nepalese Pandit Chakna Shanta Bhadra and the Tibetan translator Dro Sangkar Geshe Shakyaprabha.
